ccre.ctrl

Class Mixing

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.Mixing

  • public class Mixing
extends java.lang.Object
    Mixing is a class that provides a wide variety of useful static methods to accomplish various common actions using channels. Common actions involving teleoperating the robot can be found in DriverImpls.
    See Also:
    DriverImpls

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static BooleanOutput booleanSelectFloat(FloatOutput controlled,
                               float off,
                               float on)
        Sets the given FloatOutput to one of two values depending on what was written to the returned BooleanOutput. This would be useful if a motor could only be 75% power or 0% power and you wanted to control it using a boolean.
        Parameters:
        controlled - the FloatOutput to controll.
        off - the value to send if the boolean is false.
        on - the value to send if the boolean is true.
        Returns:
        the BooleanOutput that will now control the provided FloatOutput.

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static FloatInput booleanSelectFloat(BooleanInput selector,
                            float off,
                            float on)
        Provides a FloatInput that contains a value selected from the two float arguments based on the state of the specified BooleanInput.
        Parameters:
        selector - the value to select the float value based on.
        off - the value to use when false
        on - the value to use when true
        Returns:
        the FloatInput calculated from the selector's value and the two floats.

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static FloatInput booleanSelectFloat(BooleanInputProducer selector,
                            boolean default_,
                            float off,
                            float on)
        Provides a FloatInput that contains a value selected from the two float arguments based on the state of the specified BooleanInputProducer.
        Parameters:
        selector - the value to select the float value based on.
        default_ - the value to assume for the BooleanInputProducer before any changes are detected.
        off - the value to use when false
        on - the value to use when true
        Returns:
        the FloatInput calculated from the selector's value and the two floats.

        Parameters:

        on - the value to use when true

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static BooleanOutput booleanSelectFloat(FloatOutput target,
                               FloatInputPoll off,
                               FloatInputPoll on)
        The returned BooleanOutput is a way to modify the specified target. When the BooleanOutput is changed, the target is set to the current value of the associated parameter (the on parameter if true, the off parameter if false). Warning: changes to the FloatInputPoll parameters will not modify the output until the BooleanOutput is written to!
        Parameters:
        target - the FloatOutput to write to.
        off - the value to write if the written boolean is false.
        on - the value to write if the written boolean is true.
        Returns:
        the BooleanOutput that will modify the specified target.

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static FloatInput booleanSelectFloat(BooleanInput selector,
                            FloatInputPoll off,
                            FloatInputPoll on)
        Returns a FloatInput with a value selected from two FloatInputPolls based on the BooleanInput's value. Warning: changes to the FloatInputPoll parameters will not modify the output until the BooleanInput changes!
        Parameters:
        selector - the selector to choose an input using.
        off - if the selector is false.
        on - if the selector is true.
        Returns:
        the value selected based on the selector's value and the statuses of the two arguments.

      • booleanSelectFloat

        public static FloatInput booleanSelectFloat(BooleanInputProducer selector,
                            boolean default_,
                            FloatInputPoll off,
                            FloatInputPoll on)
        Returns a FloatInput with a value selected from two FloatInputPolls based on the BooleanInputProducer's value. Warning: changes to the FloatInputPoll parameters will not modify the output until the BooleanInputProducer changes!
        Parameters:
        selector - the selector to choose an input using.
        default_ - the value to default the selector to before it changes.
        off - if the selector is false.
        on - if the selector is true.
        Returns:
        the value selected based on the selector's value and the statuses of the two arguments.

      • triggerWhenBooleanChanges

        public static BooleanOutput triggerWhenBooleanChanges(EventConsumer toFalse,
                                      EventConsumer toTrue)
        Returns a BooleanOutput, and when the value written to it changes, it fires the associated event. This will only fire when the value changes, and is false by default.
        Parameters:
        toFalse - if the output becomes false.
        toTrue - if the output becomes true.
        Returns:
        the output that can trigger the events.

      • whenBooleanBecomes

        public static EventSource whenBooleanBecomes(BooleanInputPoll input,
                             boolean target,
                             EventSource checkTrigger)
        When the checkTrigger event is fired, check if the specified input has changed to the target value since the last check. If it has, then the returned EventSource is fired.
        Parameters:
        input - the value to check.
        target - the target value to trigger the event.
        checkTrigger - when to check for changes.
        Returns:
        the EventSource that is fired when the input becomes the target.

        Parameters:

        target - the target value to trigger the event.
        Returns:

      • normalizeFloat

        public static FloatInputPoll normalizeFloat(FloatInputPoll base,
                            float zero,
                            float one)
        Returns a scaled version of the specified input, such that when the value from the specified input is the value in the one parameter, the output is 1.0, and when the value from the specified input is the value in the zero parameter, the output is 0.0. The value is linearly scaled, for example: a value of ((zero + one) / 2) will create an output of 0.5. There is no capping - the output can be any number, including a number out of the range of zero to one. The scaling is equivalent to: (base.readValue() - zero) / (one - zero)
        Parameters:
        base - the value to scale.
        zero - the value of base that turns into 0.0.
        one - the value of base that turns into 1.0.
        Returns:
        the scaled value.

      • floatIsAtLeast

        public static BooleanInputPoll floatIsAtLeast(FloatInputPoll base,
                              float minimum)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when the specified float input is at least the specified minimum value.
        Parameters:
        base - the value to test
        minimum - the minimum value
        Returns:
        an input that represents the value being at least the minimum.

      • floatIsAtMost

        public static BooleanInputPoll floatIsAtMost(FloatInputPoll base,
                             float maximum)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when the specified float input is at most the specified maximum value.
        Parameters:
        base - the value to test
        maximum - the maximum value
        Returns:
        an input that represents the value being at most the maximum.

      • floatIsInRange

        public static BooleanInputPoll floatIsInRange(FloatInputPoll base,
                              float minimum,
                              float maximum)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when the specified float input is in the range of the specified minimum and maximum, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        base - the value to test
        minimum - the minimum value
        maximum - the maximum value
        Returns:
        an input that represents the value being in range

      • floatIsOutsideRange

        public static BooleanInputPoll floatIsOutsideRange(FloatInputPoll base,
                                   float minimum,
                                   float maximum)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when the specified float input is outside of the range of the specified minimum and maximum. It will be false at the minimum or maximum.
        Parameters:
        base - the value to test
        minimum - the minimum value
        maximum - the maximum value
        Returns:
        an input that represents the value being outside the range

      • createDispatch

        public static BooleanInput createDispatch(BooleanInputPoll input,
                          EventSource trigger)
        Return a BooleanInput that is the same as the specified BooleanInputPoll, except that it is also a producer that will update whenever the specified event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        input - the original input.
        trigger - the event to dispatch at.
        Returns:
        the dispatchable input.

      • createDispatch

        public static FloatInput createDispatch(FloatInputPoll input,
                        EventSource trigger)
        Return a FloatInput that is the same as the specified FloatInputPoll, except that it is also a producer that will update whenever the specified event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        input - the original input.
        trigger - the event to dispatch at.
        Returns:
        the dispatchable input.
